result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK] case called at 10:31am 
Defendant Joshua J Wakley in court with Attorney Scott Mccarthy.  DA Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Mccarthy requests the scheduling of a plea hearing; the Defense may be asking for a pre-sentence investigation. 
recess 10:34am 

NEXT:  Plea Hearing on December 22nd at 11:00am (JA-note in calendar comments that case may proceed to sentencing also, or the Defense may be requesting a PSI)

Pre-trial conference on September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:31 AM.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Joshua J Wakley in court.  Attorney Scott K. Mccarthy in court for Joshua J Wakley.  Attorney Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver form submitted.
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding and intent.  Court accepts the waiver.
Court finds probable cause that the Def. committed a felony and binds the Def. over for arraignment and trial. 

ARRAIGNMENT:
Information filed.  Service of Information admitted; reading waived.  Maximum penalties recited.  
Not guilty plea entered as to all counts.  
Atty. McCarthy notes that the Defendant's name had been spelling incorrectly on the Complaint but is now correct on the Information. 
Recess 8:38am

NEXT:
PTC - 9/28/22 at 10am
STC (likely Plea/Sent.) - 10/31/22 at 10:30am
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Payable Number: 194037,
Receipt Number: 22R 014043,
Amount: $20.00

Order to Seal Victim Key

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua J Wakley
Current: 4036 S. Clover Dr., New Berlin, WI 53146 United States  (Effective: 07-28-2022)
Prior: 1012 W Shaw CT, Apt 6, Whitewater, WI 53190

1:41 PM.  Clerk - CRHI
Prosecuting attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua J Wakley, in custody and Atty. McCarthy appeared by video.
Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient by agreement of counsel. 
Address change provided and DOB on Complaint verified. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge(*s) and maximum penalties are recited.

The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing 9/1/22 at 8:30am.

The Court requires a $7500.00 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence.
--no contact with the named victim #1.
-- no presence at Shaw Court residence except once with a law enforcement office to obtain his belongings.  If it takes more than 15 minutes, the defense should arrange for an off-duty officer at his own expense. Only to obtain belonging that are clearing the sole belonging of the defendant.  Any disputes about belongings will need to be addressed by a civil court.  
-- no physical discipline of any child. 
Recess 1:52pm

NEXT:   
Prelim. Hrg. - 9/1/22 at 8:30am. (Likely waiver.)
Proposed Order to Seal Victim Key
